trans-unit.source: The DirectoryOperationException class is an exception thrown by the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.SendRequest%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to indicate that the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.
The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class.
The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified message.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> object using the specified response object and message.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified serialization information and streaming context.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.

The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.

The DirectoryOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response object, message, and inner exception.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.
The GetObjectData method populates the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the data required to serialize the parameter.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.
The Response property specifies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that contains an error.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that contains an error.
